question.questionText: Carrie wanted to find out which was harder, a penny or a nickel, so she did a scratch test. How would this tell her which is harder?

referenceAnswers.referenceAnswer: The harder coin will scratch the other.

studentAnswers.studentAnswer: You could tell if it has the hardest if most of it came off.
If just the penny could scratch and the nickel could not the penny is harder.
Whichever one was damaged most was less hard.
Rub them against a crystal.
Which had less scratches.
If it makes a scratch or a little dent.
Well she can take the penny and the nickel and rub them together.
The one that is scratched is softer.
She could tell which is harder by getting a rock and seeing if the penny or nickel would scratch it. Whichever one does is harder.
Maybe he should scratch even other then when you are done see if one have scratches.
It would tell her because she could scratch the penny on the nickel and the nickel on the penny and see which one is scratched.

By the one that leave a mark on one. That means that that one is harder.

If the penny gets scratched the nickel is harder and if the nickel gets scratched then the penny is harder.
